text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with what do you call cheese isn't
yours nacho cheese that's right I'm
going to show you how to make your own
homemade nacho cheese sauce a million
times better tasting than that junk you
buy at the store and here is how you do
it so over medium heat in a saucepan
we're gonna melt some butter we're going
to add some flour because we're making a
roux you're just going to simply cook
the flour in the butter stirring pretty
much constantly for about three or four
minutes until we take that raw edge off
the flour and it smells like cooked pie
crust by the way if the roux the roux
the roux is on fire your heat was too
high so when your roux is ready you're
gonna go ahead and drizzle in three cups
of cold milk slowly at first but don't
get too nervous because as you well know
cold milk hot Roux equals no lumps so
drizzling the first cup kind of slowly
and when the first half or so is in you
can just dump the rest in and we're just
going to simmer this stirring
occasionally for about five minutes now
there's not a ton of ruin this okay so
don't expect a really thick gloppy sauce
all right this is going to stay pretty
thin alright so don't be nervous
and then during this five minute
simmering time we can go ahead and spice
this up so I'm going to go with some
chipotle powder some ancho chili powder
some paprika and cayenne that's right
for different kinds of pepper by the way
I was trying to get this really sexy
close-up shot of the spices and of
course the steam from my simmering white
sauce screwed it up and made it all
blurry are you annoyed as I am at that
probably not all right I'm also going to
stir in some salt and that white sauce
is pretty much ready so at this point
we're going to add our grated cheese and
it is critical that you reduce the heat
to low all right if you boil or simmer
the sauce while the cheese is in it it
will get grainy it will get greasy it
will get gross and nobody wants that so
turn your heat down to the lowest
setting and I'm going to add half my
cheese I'm using a combination of white
cheddar Munster and Monterey Jack and
when that's all melted in which is only
going to take a couple minutes I'll go
ahead and add this
second half of the cheese and when
that's stirred in our nacho cheese sauce
is done and you can kind of see here is
the cheese is just about all melted that
really this is not a super thick sauce
this is supposed to be like melted
cheese being poured onto your chips not
a thick cream sauce that's flavored with
cheese okay this is supposed to simulate
like pure melted cheese on your chips so
that's what we're going for and that's
why we don't want a super super thick
white sauce to start with all right once
all our cheese is in we're down to the
final step which is of course tasting
and adjusting do not make a rookie
mistake and taste on your finger dip a
chip in why because the chips you're
going to serve this with or probably
seasoned somehow so you're going to want
to taste it with the chips you don't
over salt the dip so at this point I
decided mine was seasoned perfectly
except for that's right a little more
cayenne and there you go because I used
white cheddar my cheese sauce is this
sort of pale orange color which I like
if you want that dayglo gold color use
the orange cheddar no problem it's not
artificial by the way all right I
explained that in the blog post and
that's it
our nacho cheese sauce is done you can
bring that to the table I garnish with a
little bit of cayenne and my patented
three pickled jalapeno ring garnish all
right throw some chips next to it if you
want to keep it on a warming plate of
course that's fine this holds
beautifully or of course you can serve
these as individual nachos labeled over
chips and the only reason I'm showing
you this is that's right so you have to
watch nacho cheese sauce flowing over
chips I'm sorry but you know you wanted
to see it I'm going to finish with some
pickled jalapeno rings of course those
are homemade all right I'll show you
that video next and there you go so
delicious perfect texture just a really
intense cheesy flavor beautiful spice
from the chilies just a great version in
my opinion of course it's more expensive
and harder to make at home but that's
okay it's the Super Bowl you're supposed
to put out a little more effort do you
think Tim Tebow is going to be watching
the game Sunday eating store-bought
nacho cheese sauce hell no he's going to
make it at home in fact he'll probably
hear about me mentioning him and use
this recipe anyway I hope you give that
a try head over to food wishes comm for
all the ingredient
and more information as usual and as
